description: From Middle English sahtlen, which merged with set(t)len, as in the standard English form settle (which see).

verbs.description: sattle (third-person singular simple present sattles, present participle sattling, simple past and past participle sattled)

entries.meaning: (UK, dialectal) Alternative form of settle, especially in the senses of "silence; become or make calm or orderly; adjust differences or accounts; settle down".
examples: He'll seun sattle obstropolous Billy â€” Nee mair he'll refuse for a way-leave to pay.
